intro: Margaritopsis, commonly known as the glassy bladderwort, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Lentibacillaceae. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures that trap air and help the plant float. These structures are often transparent and resemble tiny glass bubbles, giving the plant its common name. Margaritopsis species are typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. The plant is adapted to low-light conditions and plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms.
